comments.message: Hi-I like the idea-but one problem is how to keep it inflated so they dont suffocate in the plastic-or have a CO2 build up. It takes energy to operate the fans and theres a possible exposure to airborne droplets when its pressurized-They do it -but its not easy-but its would work if they could solve those problems

description:
Since Ebola is a level 4 pathogen, and the full suits cost 1,000 where there is not enough funding for all health care workers exposed to potential patients referred to hospitals, 

What about providing full coverage suits for containing the suspected patients instead of infecting the ambulances, police cars, and/or hospital areas where the patients are brought in. These could be less expensive and disposable, and is cheaper to provide for the one patient if not all the health workers and personnel can be equipped with level 4 suits.
summary: Can disposable full coverage suits be provided when intaking suspected patients?
title: Why not provide full coverage disposable suits for suspected patients?
